trends.theseChartsIllustrate1: These charts illustrate the change in availability of the species occurrence records over time.
trends.occByKingdomChartText: The number of available records categorized by kingdom. "Unknown" includes records with taxonomic information that cannot be linked to available taxonomic checklists.
trends.theseChartsIllustrate2: These charts illustrate the change in the number of species for which occurrence records are available.
trends.numOccSpeciesByKingdom: The number of species with available occurrence records, categorized by kingdom.
trends.numSpeciesFromSpecimens: The number of species associated with specimen records.
trends.numSpeciesAssociatedWithObsRecords: The number of species associated with observation records.
trends.theseChartsIllustrate3: These charts illustrate changes in the spread of records by year of occurrence and by day of year, indicating the extent of possible bias towards more recent periods or particular seasons. Snapshots are provided for approximately 3-year intervals to show changes in spread.
trends.theNumberOfOccurrenceRecordsAvailable: The number of occurrence records available for each year since 1950.
trends.theNumberOfSpeciesForWhichRecordsAreAvai: The number of species (see above) for which records are available for each year since 1950.
trends.recordsAvailableForEachDayOfTheYear: The number of occurrence records available for each day of the year.
trends.speciesForWhichRecordsAreAvailableForEac: The number of species (see above) for which records are available for each day of the year.
trends.theseChartsMayRevealPatternsThatRepresen: These charts may reveal patterns that represent biases in data collection (seasonality, public holidays) or potential issues in data management (disproportionate numbers of records shown for the first or last days in the year or each month or week). Such issues may arise at various stages in data processing and require further investigation.
trends.theseChartsIllustrate4: These charts illustrate changes in the completeness (see below) of available records and in the precision of these records with respect to time, geography and taxonomy.
trends.aRecordIsHereDefinedToBeCompleteIfItIncl: A record is here defined to be complete if it includes an identification at least to species rank, valid coordinates, a full date of occurrence and a given basis of record (e.g. Observation, specimen etc).
trends.theseChartsIllustrate5: These charts illustrate changes in the number of records considered complete according to the definition above. Separate charts separately show the same information for specimen records and for observation records. Subsequent charts illustrate the component elements that affect the number of complete records.
trends.theseChartsIllustrate6: These charts illustrate changes in the number of available records which include an identification at least to the species rank. The numbers of records identified to an infraspecific rank or to a genus are also shown.
trends.theseChartsIllustrate7: These charts illustrate changes in the number of available records which include coordinates for which no known issues have been detected. For records without accepted valid coordinates, these charts also show the number of records for which the country of occurrence is known.
trends.theseChartsIllustrate8: These charts illustrate changes in the number of available records which include a complete date including year, month and day. The numbers of records including only the month and year or only the year are also shown.
trends.theseChartsIllustrate9: These charts illustrate change in the number of species for which occurrence records are available and the geographic coverage of records for each species at different scales. In each chart, species are classified by the number of cells at a given scale for which occurrence records for the species are available. More cells indicates greater data coverage for the species. Naturally, some species are only known from a small area, so low cell counts do not necessarily indicate lack of relevant data.
trends.dataSharingWithCountryOfOrigin: Data sharing with country of origin
trends.thisChartShowsGlobalTrends: This chart shows the total number of records published through GBIF over time, with separate colours for records published from within the country where the species occurred, and those shared by publishers from other countries.
